history.narrative: Law 6-115, the “Parental Kidnapping Prevention Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-311, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 11, 1986, and March 25, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 8, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-150 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
